name: Thorin Oakenshield
description: Thorin II Oakenshield, son of Thráin, son of Thrór, King under the Mountain is a fictional character in J. R. R. Tolkien's 1937 novel The Hobbit. Thorin is the leader of the Company of Dwarves who aim to reclaim the Lonely Mountain from Smaug the dragon. He is the son of Thráin II, grandson of Thrór, and becomes King of Durin's Folk during their exile from Erebor. Thorin's background is further elaborated in Appendix A of Tolkien's 1955 novel The Return of the King.

name: Fili and Kili
description: Fíli and Kíli are fictional characters in J. R. R. Tolkien's Middle-earth legendarium. They are brothers, the nephews of Thorin Oakenshield. The brothers, along with their uncle Thorin and twelve other Dwarves, were the only ones to survive the perilous quest to reclaim the Lonely Mountain from Smaug the dragon.
